Eggnog Ice Cream

Jump to Recipe

Indulge in the creamy and nostalgic flavors of the holiday season with our delightful Eggnog Ice Cream recipe! Perfect for festive gatherings or simply enjoying a scoop on a chilly evening, this homemade ice cream combines the rich, spiced essence of traditional eggnog with the smooth, velvety texture of ice cream. With just a handful of ingredients, including eggnog, heavy cream, and a sprinkle of nutmeg, you can create a deliciously decadent dessert that is sure to impress friends and family alike. Whether you're looking to elevate your holiday dessert table or treat yourself to a seasonal favorite, this Eggnog Ice Cream is an easy and satisfying choice. Get ready to whip up a batch of this luscious treat that captures the spirit of the holidays in every spoonful!

Ingredients

eggnog

Use store-bought eggnog for convenience, or make your own by mixing milk, cream, eggs, sugar, and nutmeg. If you want a non-alcoholic version, ensure to choose an eggnog that explicitly states it is alcohol-free. For a vegan option, look for plant-based eggnog made from almond milk, soy milk, or coconut milk.

heavy cream

Heavy cream contributes to the creaminess of the ice cream. If you're looking for a lighter alternative, you can substitute half-and-half, but this will result in a less rich texture. For a dairy-free option, use coconut cream or a cashew cream.

sugar

Granulated sugar is standard, but you can experiment with brown sugar for a deeper flavor. You can also use alternatives like honey, maple syrup, or granulated stevia, but note that these may alter the texture and sweetness level.

vanilla extract

Use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor. If you donâ€™t have it, you can substitute with vanilla bean paste or scrape the seeds from a vanilla pod. For a different flavor profile, consider using almond extract, but reduce the quantity as it is stronger.

ground nutmeg

Freshly grated nutmeg will provide a more intense flavor compared to pre-ground nutmeg. If you donâ€™t have nutmeg, you can substitute with ground cinnamon or allspice, but keep the amount small to avoid overpowering the eggnog flavor.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Combine the Ingredients

    In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of eggnog, 1 cup of heavy cream, 3/4 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1/2 teaspoon of ground nutmeg. Make sure to use fresh eggnog for the best flavor.

  • Step 2: Whisk Until Smooth

    Whisk the mixture thoroughly until the sugar is fully dissolved and the ingredients are well combined. This may take about 2-3 minutes of vigorous whisking. Ensure there are no lumps of sugar remaining.

  • Step 3: Churn the Mixture

    Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker. Churn according to the manufacturer's instructions, usually for about 20-25 minutes. The mixture should become thick and creamy. If you donâ€™t have an ice cream maker, pour the mixture into a shallow dish and freeze it, stirring every 30 minutes until it reaches the desired consistency.

  • Step 4: Freeze the Ice Cream

    Once churned, transfer the ice cream to an airtight container. Freeze for at least 4 hours until firm. This step is crucial for achieving the right texture.

  • Step 5: Serve and Garnish

    Scoop the ice cream into bowls or cones and serve immediately. Optionally, garnish with extra nutmeg or a dollop of whipped cream for added flavor and presentation.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to whisk ingredients together?

Use a balloon whisk or electric mixer to combine ingredients thoroughly. Start slowly to avoid splattering, and increase speed as needed. Make sure the sugar is fully dissolved for a smooth texture.

How do I know when my ice cream is finished churning?

The ice cream is ready when it has doubled in volume and has a soft-serve consistency. It typically takes about 20-25 minutes, but check your ice cream maker's instructions for specific timing.

What if I don't have an ice cream maker?

You can still make ice cream by pouring the mixture into a shallow dish and placing it in the freezer. Stir every 30 minutes for the first 2-3 hours to break up ice crystals until it reaches your desired consistency.

How can I ensure my ice cream is creamy and not icy?

Using heavy cream and churning the mixture properly will help create a creamy texture. Avoid over-freezing and ensure the mixture is well combined before churning.

What should I do if my sugar isn't dissolving?

Make sure to whisk your mixture thoroughly. If it still doesnâ€™t dissolve, you can gently heat the mixture on the stove until just warm, then whisk until the sugar is fully dissolved, and cool before pouring into the ice cream maker.

Can I adjust the flavor of my eggnog ice cream?

Absolutely! You can add spices like cinnamon or ginger for extra warmth, or even a splash of bourbon or rum for a more traditional eggnog flavor, but adjust to taste.

How do I store leftover ice cream?

Store your ice cream in an airtight container to prevent freezer burn. It can last for up to 2 weeks in the freezer, but for the best quality, consume within a week.

Is it safe to eat homemade ice cream with eggnog?

Yes, as long as you use pasteurized eggnog. If you're concerned about raw eggs, look for eggnog made with pasteurized eggs or consider using a custard base instead.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For dairy-free or vegan options, substitute the heavy cream with coconut cream and use a plant-based eggnog. If you want to reduce the sugar content, consider using a sugar substitute that measures like sugar or opt for a lower-sugar eggnog variant.

Pairings

Eggnog Ice Cream pairs wonderfully with spiced cookies, gingerbread, or rich chocolate desserts. For beverages, consider pairing it with a warm spiced cider, a glass of bourbon or rum, or a classic coffee for a delightful contrast in temperatures and flavors.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Eggnog Ice Cream in chilled bowls or glasses for an elegant touch. For a festive presentation, scoop the ice cream into a Christmas-themed sundae dish and top with a sprinkle of ground nutmeg and a dollop of freshly whipped cream. You can also serve it alongside a slice of pie, such as pumpkin or pecan, to enhance the seasonal flavors.

Eggnog Ice Cream

10 min
$6.5
250 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

DairyEggs

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Dessert

Tags:

DessertFrozen TreatsHoliday

Description

Creamy, festive eggnog ice cream that captures the flavors of the holiday season in every scoop.

Ingredients

  • eggnog: 2 cups
  • heavy cream: 1 cup
  • sugar: 3/4 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
  • ground nutmeg: 1/2 teaspoon
